metadata.name: Lady in Bronze Tower
metadata.description:
Based on Greek mythology, Danäe is a character who was locked in a bronze tower by her father. She was meant to be protected from men. As her father had a dream of her having a son, who is turned out to be his killer.
However, she was visited by Zeus while sleeping. Therefore, we can behold she was impregnated by him with golden coins running between her legs. 


This piece is inspired by Gustav Klimt's masterpiece "Danäe" 1907.
